sentences.sContent: An awful lot of people (=  a large number of people  ) died in the war.
sentences.sCn: 很多很多的人在这场战争中死去。

sentences.sContent: He made me feel an awful fool.
sentences.sCn: 他让我感觉像个大傻瓜。

sentences.sContent: ...think of joy as an unaffordable luxury in a nation where there is awful poverty...
...Not only is this a boring and awful way to treat children...
...Don’t you think it’s an awful waste of time...
...In spite of the awful inconveniences caused by racial prejudice...

synos.tran: 可怕的，吓人的；糟糕的，糟透的（口语）；庄严的，威严的

phrases.pCn: 气候恶劣；非常糟糕的天气

remMethod.val: aw(看作awe， 恐惧) ＋ ful(…的) → 令人恐惧的 → 令人不愉快的

trans.tranCn: 令人不愉快的， 难过的； 非常的， 极大的
trans.tranOther: used to emphasize how much or how good, bad etc something is
